meanings.definition: To divide into triangles or sections.
meanings.sent1: I will triangulate the map to make it easier to read.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to triangulate the canvas for a more interesting composition.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to triangulate the cake into equal slices for the party guests.
meanings.sent4: She tried to triangulate her thoughts into manageable sections.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to triangulate the shape into smaller triangles for the geometry lesson.

meanings.definition: To determine the location of something by measuring the angles of a triangle formed by lines to it from two known points.
meanings.sent1: The surveyor will triangulate the position of the buried treasure.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use satellites to triangulate the location of wildlife in the dense forest.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to triangulate the suspect's whereabouts using advanced technology.
meanings.sent4: The hiker had to triangulate her position using a compass and landmarks.
meanings.sent5: The pilot needed to triangulate the airport's coordinates for a safe landing.
